text: Cofresh Snack Foods is a company that makes savoury snacks. It is based in Leicester, United Kingdom.BBC, The Kitchen Cabinet, https://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/m0009jbp The company earns Â£28 million a year. Cofresh was started in 1974 by an Indian family who moved from Kenya to Leicester,Leicester Mercury https://www.leicestermercury.co.uk/news/business/taste-india-new-range- healthier-1617997 and used their fish and chip shop to make snacks, such as Bombay Mix. ==Products== Cofresh's main range of Indian snacks includes versions of poppadum curls, potato grills, spiced nuts, Bombay Mix and Ganthiya. In 2017, Cofresh released "Eat Real", which is a brand of gluten- free snacks. "Eat Real" snacks are mostly made from hummus or quinoa. ==References== Category:1974 establishments in the United Kingdom Category:Food companies of the United Kingdom Category:Organisations based in Leicester
title: Cofresh
